thing-type.label: FGWDS WALLI SWITCH FIBARO SINGLE SWITCH
thing-type.description: WALLI SWITCH FIBARO SINGLE SWITCH<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Walli Single Switch is a smart wall switch designed to control one light sources via Z-Wave network. It measures active power and energy consumed by the controlled load. You can install it with provided cover plate or other compatible. <br /&gtMain features of FIBARO Walli Single Switch: </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt Can be used with: <ul&gt<li&gtConventional incandescent and halogen light sources, </li&gt <li&gt LED lamps, </li&gt <li&gtFluorescent lamps, </li&gt <li&gtElectronic transformers (for ELV halogen lamps and LED bulbs), </li&gt <li&gtFerromagnetic transformers (for MLV halogen lamps). </li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtCan be used with provided cover plate or one of the following: <ul&gt<li&gtGIRA – System 55 (Standard 55, E2, Event, Event Clear), </li&gt <li&gtLegrand – Céliane, </li&gt <li&gtSchneider – Odace. </li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtActive power and energy consumption metering. </li&gt <li&gtSupports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 encryption and S2 Authenticated with PRNG-based encryption. </li&gt <li&gtWorks as Z-Wave signal repeater (all non-battery operated devices within the network will act as repeaters to increase reliability of the network). </li&gt <li&gtMay be used with all devices certified with the Z-Wave Plus certificate and should be compatible with such devices produced by other manufacturers. </li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<h1&gtTo add the device to the Z-Wave network manually:</h1&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPower the device.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtIf you are adding in Security S2 Authenticated, scan the DSK QR code or input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the adding process to end.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtAdding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtGreen - successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtMagenta - successful (Security S2 Authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtRed – not successful.</li&gt </ul&gt<h1&gtTo add the device to the Z-Wave network using SmartStart:</h1&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet the main controller in Security S2 Authenticated add mode (see the controller’s manual). </li&gt <li&gtScan the DSK QR code or input the underlined part of the DSK (label on the bottom of the box).</li&gt <li&gtPower the device.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the adding process to start (up to few minutes), which is signaled with yellow LED blinking.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtAdding result will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and the LED frame:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt Green - successful (non-secure, S0, S2 non-authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtMagenta - successful (Security S2 Authenticated),</li&gt <li&gtRed – not successful.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo remove the device from the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPower the device.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into remove mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times click one of the buttons.</li&gt <li&gtLED will start blinking yellow, wait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message and red LED colour.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtFIBARO Walli Double Switch is powered using DC power supply unit so it is always awake.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Remember device state
parameter.description: Remember device state

parameter.name: config_2_4
parameter.label: 2: First channel – overload safety switch
parameter.description: First channel – overload safety switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 (default)</td&gt <td&gtfunction disabled</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt10 to 36200</td&gt <td&gt(1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_4
parameter.label: 3: Second channel – overload safety switch
parameter.description: Second channel – overload safety switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 (default)</td&gt <td&gtfunction disabled</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt10 to 36200</td&gt <td&gt(1.0-3620.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_4
parameter.label: 10: LED frame – power limit
parameter.description: LED frame – power limit<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt(50.0-3680.0W, step 0.1W) – power threshold</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: LED frame – colour when ON
parameter.description: LED frame – colour when ON<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtLED disabled</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 (Default)</td&gt <td&gtWhite</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtRed</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtGreen</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtBlue</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtYellow</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtCyan</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt7</td&gt <td&gtMagenta</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt8</td&gt <td&gtcolour changes smoothly depending on measured power</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt9</td&gt <td&gtcolour changes in steps depending on measured power</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: LED frame – colour when OFF
parameter.description: LED frame – colour when OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 (default)</td&gt <td&gtLED disabled</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtWhite</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtRed</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt3</td&gt <td&gtGreen</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt4</td&gt <td&gtBlue</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt5</td&gt <td&gtYellow</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt6</td&gt <td&gtCyan</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt7</td&gt <td&gtMagenta</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: LED frame – brightness
parameter.description: LED frame – brightness<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gtLED disable</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 to 100<br /&gt(Default)</td&gt <td&gt(1-100% brightness)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt101</td&gt <td&gtbrightness directly proportional to measured power</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt102</td&gt <td&gtbrightness inversely proportional to measured power</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Buttons operation
parameter.description: Buttons operation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 (default)</td&gt <td&gt1 st and 2nd button toggle the load</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gt1st button turns the load ON, 2nd button turns the load OFF</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt3</td&gt <td&gt device works in 2-way/3-way switch configuration</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Buttons orientation
parameter.description: Buttons orientation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 (default)</td&gt <td&gtdefault (1st button controls 1st channel, 2nd button controls 2nd channel)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtreversed (1st button controls 2nd channel, 2nd button controls 1st channel)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Outputs orientation
parameter.description: Outputs orientation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 (default)</td&gt <td&gtdefault (Q1 - 1st channel, Q2 - 2nd channel)</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtreversed (Q1 - 2nd channel, Q2 - 1st channel)</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_152_1
parameter.label: 152: chan1reactdelayedoff
parameter.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0(default)</td&gt <td&gtcancel mode and set default state</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtno reaction - mode runs until it ends</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtreset timer - start counting from the beginning</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_153_1
parameter.label: 153: chan2reactdelayedoff
parameter.description: Second channel - reaction to switch for delayed OFF / pulse modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0(default)</td&gt <td&gtcancel mode and set default state</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1</td&gt <td&gtno reaction - mode runs until it ends</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt2</td&gt <td&gtreset timer - start counting from the beginning</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_154_2
parameter.label: 154: chan1timedelayedoff
parameter.description: First channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gt0.1 second</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 to 32000<br /&gt(Default)</td&gt <td&gt(1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_155_2
parameter.label: 155: chan2timedelayedoff
parameter.description: Second channel - time parameter for delayed OFF / pulse modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0</td&gt <td&gt0.1 second</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt1 to 32000<br /&gt(Default)</td&gt <td&gt(1-32000s, 1s step) – time parameter</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 156: chan1onsent23assgp
parameter.description: First channel – Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 to 99</td&gt <td&gt2nd association group</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255 (default)</td&gt <td&gt3rd association group</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 157: chan1offsent23assgp

parameter.name: config_158_2
parameter.label: 158: chan1doclicsent23assgp
parameter.description: First channel – Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 to 99 (default)</td&gt <td&gt2nd association group</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255</td&gt <td&gt3rd association group</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_159_2
parameter.label: 159: chan2onsent45assgp
parameter.description: Second channel – Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 to 99</td&gt <td&gt4th association group</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255<br /&gt(Default)</td&gt <td&gt5th association group</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 160: chan2offsent45assgp
parameter.description: Second channel – Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 to 99 (default)</td&gt <td&gt4th association group</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255</td&gt <td&gt5th association group</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_161_2
parameter.label: 161: chan2doclicsent23assgp
parameter.description: Second channel – Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<table&gt<tr&gt<td&gt0 to 99 (default)</td&gt <td&gt4th association group</td&gt </tr&gt<tr&gt<td&gt255</td&gt <td&gt5th association group</td&gt </tr&gt</table&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: “Lifeline” reports the device status<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: 1st channel On/Off
parameter.description: (uses Basic command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt2nd association group – “On/Off (1)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Basic command class).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: 1st channel dimmer
parameter.description: (uses Switch Multilevel command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt3rd association group – “Dimmer (1)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 1st channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: 2nd channel On/Off
parameter.description: (uses Basic command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt4th association group* – “On/Off (2)” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Basic command class).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: 2nd channel dimmer
parameter.description: (uses Switch Multilevel command class).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt5th association group* – “Dimmer (2)” is used to change level of associated devices reflecting button operation for 2nd channel (uses Switch Multilevel command class).</p&gt
